page.title: 04DEEPING ST.JAMES SEWAGE WKS
page.content: Some of the sewage doesn't go through these beds but goes to the more modern activated sludge plant. At the end of the treatment cycle the purified water is pumped into the river Welland and this in turn will reach the sea. The sludge which is left is kept in tanks and after the harvests,the East Anglian Water Board tankers take it to our local farmers.This is a free service, the sludge is an ideal soil conditioner and improves the farmers land. Originally the sludge was left to dry out on grit beds and was dug out as a solid cake.These old grit beds are still there,although they are not used any more.
